intro: Calyptranthes portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican calyptranthes, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes other well-known plants such as eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers and elliptical, glossy leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas within the subtropical forests of Puerto Rico. Calyptranthes portoricensis plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for various insects and small animals.
